meanings.definition: Not capable of being educated or taught.
meanings.sent1: The wild animal was ineducable and could not be trained.
meanings.sent2: The stubborn child was ineducable and refused to listen to the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The old computer seemed ineducable, as it kept showing error messages.
meanings.sent4: Her closed-minded attitude made her seem ineducable to new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were ineducable, preserving the secrets of the past.

meanings.sent1: The teenager was ineducable and ignored all advice from his parents.
meanings.sent2: The ineducable student refused to participate in any class activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat was ineducable when it came to learning tricks, preferring to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: His fixed mindset made him ineducable to new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The old dog was ineducable when it came to learning new tricks.
